Headline: Management Consultant | Driving Growth & Professional Transformation for Promoter-Led FMCG & Consumer Companies | Expert in Strategy, Execution & People Leadership | Creating Scalable, Sustainable & Profitable Business
Comment:
Rishabh Mariwala insightful as ever!! 

While you can't hire someone to "sell something the market does not want," you can hire someone who can help you figure out what the market¬†does¬†want and then build it.   

Also the hire might tell you the fact which founders seldom want to listen and thats  POOR MARKET FIT!!

The nuance is that senior talent isn't just a megaphone; they can be the compass and the mapmaker, especially when the initial direction is unclear or incorrect.
Ultimately, it comes down to¬†how¬†you use senior talent. If you hire them merely to "amplify your direction" when that direction is flawed, then yes, it's a wasted effort. 
But if you hire them to collaboratively find the right direction and then lead the charge, they can be an invaluable asset in solving a broken product's fundamental issues.

Headline: Experienced leader in business transformation and integration | Specialist in risk management and governance frameworks | Passionate about driving operational excellence
Comment: Rightly said Rishabh. I guess senior talent (and by seniority I presume experience) should be able to help in designing a product that would meet today's demand or make a product for which demand would arise in foreseeable future (ie anticipating the demand). Experienced colleagues should be able to guide organizations through their growth journey and enable businesses to become scalable.

Headline: Founder and Chief Enthusiasm Officer- Lookin.club | India‚Äôs Premier Referral Hiring Platform- Making Hiring Human and Credible by Leveraging Power of Networks üí™üí™üí™ Wellness Hustler and Advanced Yoga Enthusiast
Comment:
Rishabh Mariwala very true. the solution should address the real problem else no amount of expertise can fix it. For example, Recruitment market these days is cluttered with multiple solutions. Still hiring is noisy, transactional and trustless. Companies are overwhelmed with irrelevant, mass applications
Even great roles get buried under hundreds of random CVs most unvetted, many unfit. Hiring teams spend hours screening, interviewing, and still make bad or culture-misaligned hires. Meanwhile, top professionals want to refer people from their network, but they have majorly access to refer them in their current company. But what if they don't have a role available for their trusted referral in their current company? They check offline -Where do I refer them where it actually helps? That's what Lookin.club is trying to solve by reincarnating the real essence of hiring through trusted referrals, the way it used to happen before the advent of job portals. Its an invite-only platform where top industry professionals not only refer CVs, they actually put their reputation on the line and thinks about overall fit and not just a skill-match

Headline: Senior Sales Manager | Driving B2B Growth in Cable & Wires Industry | Marketing | Brand Positioning | Demand Generation
Comment:
Absolutely spot on.
The best talent can accelerate a good idea but they can‚Äôt invent demand that isn‚Äôt there.
Clarity comes first. Customers come first. Product-market fit comes first.
If you don‚Äôt know who you‚Äôre serving and why they‚Äôll pay you no big name can rescue you.
Get the basics right. Then build the dream team to scale it.

Headline: Building "Doodle" Premium artisanal candy brand I Ex- Unilever I Ex-Cadbury I Ex-Chipita SA
Comment:
Couldn't agree more Rishabh Mariwala!  Leadership can't salvage a product that lacks resonance. At Doodle, we‚Äôve seen firsthand that product-market fit is not just a milestone, it‚Äôs the soul of sustainable growth. 

We didn‚Äôt start with just a recipe, we started with a promise, premium handmade candy that connects deeply with customers across India through nostalgia, storytelling, and social impact. From small mom- and-pop stores in Mumbai and (West India) to high-footfall retailers Like "Raj Mandir" in Delhi, the pull has been organic, repeat-worthy, and expanding state by state.

We‚Äôve built for delight first, then scaling  through data, distribution intelligence, and a mission that India proudly accepts. When the product is right, leaders can amplify. but they can't replace authenticity.
